Package com.company

Class SnakeNode

java.lang.Object
com.company.SnakeNode
public final class SnakeNode
extends java.lang.Object
Provides a data structure for holding the location of the player character (the snake) at any given time in the Snake game.
Version:
2.0
Author:
Lucas Champoux, Trevor Martin, Raunak Shahi

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    SnakeNode​(int pXcoord, int pYcoord)
    A constructor that creates a body segment of the snake, and places its position on the playing field.
    SnakeNode​(int pXcoord, int pYcoord, boolean pIsHead)
    A constructor that creates the head or tail segment of the snake, and places its position on the playing field.
    SnakeNode​(SnakeNode original)
    A copy constructor for SnakeNode, cloning the SnakeNode passed in.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addTailNode()
    Adds a node to the tail of the current snake, then sets that node as the tail.
    static SnakeNode[] generateStartSnake()
    Generates a starter snake of three pixels size, built off the top-left corner coordinate, facing rightward in horizontal orientation.
    int getDirection()
    Accesses the cardinal direction in which the body segment of the snake contained within the SnakeNode is travelling.
    SnakeNode getNext()
    Accesses the next body segment in the snake, heading toward the tail.
    int getXCoord()
    Accesses the X-Coordinate of the body segment contained within the SnakeNode.
    int getYCoord()
    Accesses the Y-Coordinate of the body segment contained within the SnakeNode.
    boolean isHead()
    Checks if the current SnakeNode contains the head of the snake.
    boolean isTail()
    Checks if the current SnakeNode contains the tail of the snake.
    void moveSnake()
    Moves the snake based on the direction it is facing.
    void setDirection​(int pDirection)
    Modifies the cardinal direction in which the body segment of the snake contained within the SnakeNode is travelling.
    void setTail​(boolean tail)
    Changes whether the body segment contained within the current SnakeNode is the tail or not.
    void setYCoord​(int pYcoord)
    Modifies the Y-Coordinate of the body segment contained within the SnakeNode.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • SnakeNode

      public SnakeNode​(int pXcoord, int pYcoord)
      A constructor that creates a body segment of the snake, and places its position on the playing field.
      Parameters:
      pXcoord - The X-Coordinate of the body segment on the playing field.
      pYcoord - The Y-Coordinate of the body segment on the playing field.

    • SnakeNode

      public SnakeNode​(int pXcoord, int pYcoord, boolean pIsHead)
      A constructor that creates the head or tail segment of the snake, and places its position on the playing field.
      Parameters:
      pXcoord - The X-Coordinate of the body segment on the playing field.
      pYcoord - The Y-Coordinate of the body segment on the playing field.
      pIsHead - A boolean value determining whether the segment is the head of the snake (true) or the tail of the snake (false).

    • SnakeNode

      public SnakeNode​(SnakeNode original)
      A copy constructor for SnakeNode, cloning the SnakeNode passed in.
      Parameters:
      original - The SnakeNode designed to be cloned.

  • Method Details

    • getXCoord

      public int getXCoord()
      Accesses the X-Coordinate of the body segment contained within the SnakeNode.
      Returns:
      The X-Coordinate of the body segment contained within the SnakeNode.

    • getYCoord

      public int getYCoord()
      Accesses the Y-Coordinate of the body segment contained within the SnakeNode.
      Returns:
      The Y-Coordinate of the body segment contained within the SnakeNode.

    • setYCoord

      public void setYCoord​(int pYcoord)
      Modifies the Y-Coordinate of the body segment contained within the SnakeNode.
      Parameters:
      pYcoord - The desired new Y-Coordinate.

    • getNext

      public SnakeNode getNext()
      Accesses the next body segment in the snake, heading toward the tail.
      Returns:
      The next SnakeNode in the snake, heading toward the tail.

    • getDirection

      public int getDirection()
      Accesses the cardinal direction in which the body segment of the snake contained within the SnakeNode is travelling.
      Returns:
      The cardinal direction of travel held within the SnakeNode.

    • setDirection

      public void setDirection​(int pDirection)
      Modifies the cardinal direction in which the body segment of the snake contained within the SnakeNode is travelling.
      Parameters:
      pDirection - The new direction of travel held within the SnakeNode.

    • isHead

      public boolean isHead()
      Checks if the current SnakeNode contains the head of the snake.
      Returns:
      true if the current SnakeNode contains the head, false otherwise.

    • isTail

      public boolean isTail()
      Checks if the current SnakeNode contains the tail of the snake.
      Returns:
      true if the current SnakeNode contains the tail, false otherwise.

    • setTail

      public void setTail​(boolean tail)
      Changes whether the body segment contained within the current SnakeNode is the tail or not.
      Parameters:
      tail - true if desired to set as tail, false if desired to set not as tail.

    • generateStartSnake

      public static SnakeNode[] generateStartSnake()
      Generates a starter snake of three pixels size, built off the top-left corner coordinate, facing rightward in horizontal orientation.
      Returns:
      An array containing the head node at index 0, and the tail node at index 1, of the newly created snake.

    • addTailNode

      public void addTailNode()
      Adds a node to the tail of the current snake, then sets that node as the tail.

    • moveSnake

      public void moveSnake()
      Moves the snake based on the direction it is facing.
